title: Returning ex-toxic player; how do I ensure I don't get banned?
body:
Heya forums, so now that I'm a grown man I don't flip out in games as much. I used to troll hard in this game because I was bored, got lots of bans (probably at least 4 or 5 tbh; last one I think was a month).

I'm keeping a level head as best as I can, I dropped a lot of money on skins/cosmetics and don't want to lose any progress.

Is there a way to ensure I don't get banned again because I fear that my next one may be a perma and I'll lose my progress/skins/champs.

Thanks and much love
-Farkinob

EDIT: I should elaborate that I would like to know what is acceptable/what isn't because this game seems more strict

replies.body:
don't type and don't intentionally feed and you're guaranteed to not get banned. 

If you have to type, limit it to things strictly pertaining to gameplay, like "rakan F" "noct by top" "dragon up"
Also don't steal other player's assigned roles in ranked and draft and don't troll in ways that aren't intentional feeding.

Ye i double dip this start talking in morse codes  and acronyms.

.... .... . ... .. ... .. ..... .. .. . . ... .. .... ... . 

I bt y dn kw wtf d i jt wrt  i dt kn t thr ls ts snt crnym.

THIS  is  quality st ptng.

Don't insult other players.

Don't call for other players to be reported. Just report them yourself. 1 report in 1 game has the same effect as 9 reports in 1 game.

If someone is trolling, or being an asshole, or scripting, or breaking the rules in some other way, don't comment on it in chat. Just report them after the game.

Don't use "zero-tolerance" words in any context. These include, but are not necessarily limited to, homophobic, racial or ethnic slurs, anything encouraging suicide (including the acronym "kys"), and, what appears recently added to this list, the R word.

Don't get into arguments in chat.

Try to avoid negativity in general in chat (things like complaining).

Don't intentionally feed.

Don't troll in ways that aren't intentional feeding.

Don't play a different role than the one you were assigned in ranked or draft unless the player you're swapping with has clearly agreed to it beforehand.
This was really clear thank you

Only type useful things, like when you want to tell your team what the strategy is; ie - take dragon, baron, towers, etc. If they're being friendly feel free to banter along but if you dont have much useful to add limit it or dont type it. That's the best advice I can give.

Providing if your speech is not used for harassment / insult. Anything is fine. 

I want a kill honey bunny is not directed as an insult, so it's fine. 

Your 2.5 years of inactivity won't do anything to reduce how close you are towards a punishment. Only games played will decrease your toxicity meter.

Be a good player. Don't flame or be rude in chat. Don't afk, troll, or intentionally feed. Don't grief and have a pessimistic mindset such as "FF" "can't win" "lost game" when the game is especially winnable. I have seen so many people say this just at 5 mins into the game

Also, many people say "report <player>"  in chat. DO NOT DO THIS. It is a toxic behaviour that many do not realize

And while you're at it, do not spam pings for being toxic. I have seen many toxic people who spam pings the person that muted them.

Hey, 

Try to keep your chat to helpful, game-related objectives. Focusing on the future is always helpful, whereas you tend to see players punished when they focus on previous instances in the game. 

Avoid insulting others. 

Mute other players when you feel their chat has been consistently negative and will continue to be that way. 

You can peruse some discussions on here to give you a good idea of what's acceptable and unacceptable in game.
